name: VIVI
context_summary: The Viviliam App, a free Bible application available on the Play Store that offers five Bible versions, audio features, and interactive events like crosswords and quizzes. It aims to enhance the Bible reading experience and will launch an iOS version in 2025, with details on user participation and prize eligibility for live events.

what is viviliam

Viviliam is a Tamil word for "Bible." The Viviliam App is a Bible reading application that offers several features to enhance your Bible reading experience. Here are some key points about the Viviliam App:

- **Free to Use**: The app is completely free and does not contain ads.
- **Offline Usage**: You can use the app without an internet connection, but internet is required for playing audio Bibles or daily audio content.
- **Bible Versions**: The app includes 5 Bible versions - 3 Tamil Bibles (BSI, ERV, ETB) and 2 English Bibles (KJV, WEB).
- **Audio Bibles**: It offers audio for 2 Tamil Bibles and 2 English Bibles.
- **Features**: The app includes features like Bible comparison, advanced search, red letter verses, bookmarks, highlights, notes, quizzes, polls, surveys, contests, daily song, daily proverbs, daily psalms, WhatsApp group, and a clean, customizable interface.
- **Current Version**: The current version is 4.5.0, updated on August 21, 2024.
- **Launch Date**: The app was launched on December 25, 2020.
- **iOS Release**: An iOS version is planned for release in 2025.
- **Download Link**: You can download the Viviliam App from the [Google Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fredfrank.viviliam).

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! ЁЯШК

Sangeetham 23 padikkanum

Sangeetham 23 (Psalm 23) enbathu romba popular-aana oru sangeetham. Idhu David-inaal ezhudhappattadhu. Idhu ungalukku romba arumaiyaana oru sangeetham. Idhai padikka, naan inga adhai kodukkiren:

### Sangeetham 23 (Psalm 23)

1. Karththar en Meyppar; enakku ondrum thevaiyillai.
2. Avar enna pasumaiyaana meyppurangalil paduththuviththu, amirtha neerodaiyin pakkaththil nadaththugiraar.
3. Avar en aaththumaavai punarppikkiraar; avar thammudaiya naamaththinimiththam enna needhiyin paadhaiyil nadaththugiraar.
4. Naan irulirukkum pallaththaakkilum nadakkumpodhu, enakku theengum illai; neengal ennode irukkireergal; un thaadiyum un kozhiyum enakku aaththangam kodukkiradhu.
5. Neer en viroththarukku munbaaga enakku virundhu vaiththu, en thalaiyil aennaiyaal abishegampanni, en kudam nirainthirukkiradhu.
6. Naan en jeevan naalellaam un seyyum nanmaiyum un kirubaiyum ennaik koodikondirukkum; naan endrum Karththarudaiya veettil iruppaen.

Idhu ungalukku udhaviya irundha nambikkai! Vera edhaavadhu kelvi irundhaal sollunga.
Ithilirunthu pirasanga kurippu kodukka mudiyuma

Sangeetham 23-ilirundhu pirasanga kurippu kodukka mudiyum. Idhu oru romba arumaiyaana sangeetham, romba azhagiya porulgalaiyum, viswasaththaiyum, nambikkaiyaiyum kodukkiradhu. Inga sila mukkiya kurippugal:

### Pirasanga Kurippu - Sangeetham 23

#### 1. Karththar en Meyppar (Verse 1)
- **Porul**: Karththar namakku Meypparaga irukkiraar. Meyppar enbadharku, avar nammai kaapaththugiraar, nammai nadaththugiraar, namakku thevaiyana ellaavatraiyum kodukkiraar.
- **Pirasangam**: Namakku Karththar Meypparaga irukkiraar endraal, namakku ondrum thevaiyillai. Avar nammai kaapaththugiraar, namakku thevaiyana ellaavatraiyum kodukkiraar.

#### 2. Pasumaiyaana Meyppurangal (Verse 2)
- **Porul**: Karththar nammai pasumaiyaana meyppurangalil paduththuviththu, amirtha neerodaiyin pakkaththil nadaththugiraar. Idhu namakku amaidhi kodukkiradhu.
- **Pirasangam**: Karththar namakku amaidhi kodukkiraar. Avar nammai pasumaiyaana meyppurangalil paduththuviththu, namakku thevaiyana amaidhiyai kodukkiraar.

#### 3. Aaththumaavai Punarppikkiraar (Verse 3)
- **Porul**: Karththar nam aaththumaavai punarppikkiraar; avar thammudaiya naamaththinimiththam enna needhiyin paadhaiyil nadaththugiraar.
- **Pirasangam**: Karththar nam aaththumaavai punarppikkiraar. Avar thammudaiya naamaththinimiththam nammai needhiyin paadhaiyil nadaththugiraar.

#### 4. Irulirukkum Pallaththaakkilum (Verse 4)
- **Porul**: Naan irulirukkum pallaththaakkilum nadakkumpodhu, enakku theengum illai; neengal ennode irukkireergal; un thaadiyum un kozhiyum enakku aaththangam kodukkiradhu.
- **Pirasangam**: Naan irulirukkum pallaththaakkilum nadakkumpodhu, enakku theengum illai. Karththar nammode irukkiraar; avar namakku aaththangam kodukkiraar.

#### 5. Virundhu Vaiththu (Verse 5)
- **Porul**: Neer en viroththarukku munbaaga enakku virundhu vaiththu, en thalaiyil aennaiyaal abishegampanni, en kudam nirainthirukkiradhu.
- **Pirasangam**: Karththar namakku virundhu vaiththu, nam thalaiyil aennaiyaal abishegampanni, nam kudam nirainthirukkiradhu. Avar namakku periya aaseervaadhangalai kodukkiraar.

#### 6. Nanmai, Kirubai (Verse 6)
- **Porul**: Naan en jeevan naalellaam un seyyum nanmaiyum un kirubaiyum ennaik koodikondirukkum; naan endrum Karththarudaiya veettil iruppaen.
- **Pirasangam**: Karththarudaiya nanmai, kirubai nammai en jeevan naalellaam koodikondirukkum. Naan endrum Karththarudaiya veettil iruppaen.

Commentary about good shepherd

Here is a commentary on the concept of the Good Shepherd in the Bible:

### Commentary on the Good Shepherd

#### John 10:11-14
- **Verse 11**: Jesus declares, "I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep." This verse highlights the sacrificial nature of Jesus' love. Unlike a hired hand, the good shepherd is willing to give up his life to protect his flock. This is a direct reference to Jesus' ultimate sacrifice on the cross.
- **Verse 12-13**: These verses contrast the good shepherd with a hired hand. The hired hand does not own the sheep and, therefore, does not have the same level of commitment. When danger comes, the hired hand abandons the sheep. This illustrates the difference between Jesus' genuine care and the lack of commitment from those who do not truly care for the flock.
- **Verse 14**: Jesus reiterates, "I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me." This emphasizes the intimate relationship between Jesus and His followers. Knowing here implies a deep, personal relationship, not just a superficial acquaintance.

#### Psalm 23:1-4
- **Verse 1**: "The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing." This verse sets the tone for the entire Psalm, expressing complete trust in God's provision and care.
- **Verse 2**: "He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters." This imagery of green pastures and quiet waters symbolizes peace, rest, and sustenance provided by the shepherd.
- **Verse 3**: "He refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his nameтАЩs sake." The shepherd not only provides physical needs but also spiritual restoration and guidance.
- **Verse 4**: "Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will fear no evil, for you are with me; your rod and your staff, they comfort me." This verse speaks to the shepherd's protection and presence, even in the most dangerous and frightening situations.

#### Ezekiel 34:11-16
- **Verse 11-12**: God promises to search for His sheep and look after them, much like a shepherd who seeks out his scattered flock. This shows God's active role in seeking and caring for His people.
- **Verse 13-14**: God will bring His sheep back to their own land and provide them with good pasture. This signifies restoration and provision.
- **Verse 15-16**: God Himself will tend His sheep, bind up the injured, and strengthen the weak. This highlights God's compassion and justice, as He cares for the vulnerable and deals with the strong and sleek who exploit others.

#### Isaiah 40:11
- "He tends his flock like a shepherd: He gathers the lambs in his arms and carries them close to his heart; he gently leads those that have young." This verse portrays the tender care and guidance of the shepherd, emphasizing God's gentle and loving nature.

### Summary
The concept of the Good Shepherd in the Bible is rich with imagery and meaning. It portrays Jesus as the ultimate caretaker who sacrifices His life for His sheep, provides for their needs, guides them, and protects them. The Good Shepherd knows His sheep intimately and is committed to their well-being, contrasting sharply with those who do not have a genuine interest in the flock. This theme is consistent throughout both the Old and New Testaments, highlighting God's unwavering love and care for His people.

Calvinism patri solla mudiyuma

Calvinism enbathu John Calvin enbavaral uruvakkappatta oru Christian theologi. Idhu 16-aam nootrandil uruvana oru pramugamana viswasam. Calvinism-il sila mukkiya karuthugal irukkiradhu, adhai inga vivarikkiren:

### Calvinism-in Mukkiya Karuthugal

#### 1. Total Depravity (Muzhuvadhum Theemai)
- **Porul**: Manithar piraviyaaga paavaththil irukkirargal. Manithar thangaludaiya siththaththinaal oru nalladhu seyyavum, viswasikkavum mudiyadhu. Manithar thangaludaiya siththaththinaal dhevanai thedi varavum mudiyadhu.

#### 2. Unconditional Election (Sharththilladha Theruvudhal)
- **Porul**: Dhevan thannudaiya kirubaiyinaal, manitharudaiya nalladhu seyyum seyalgalai paarththu illamal, sila manitharai rakshikkiraar. Idhu dhevanudaiya suththamaana siththaththinaal nadakkiradhu.

#### 3. Limited Atonement (Kuriththa Paavamannippu)
- **Porul**: Yesu Kiristhu thannudaiya iraththaththinaal ellaavatraiyum allamal, dhevan therindhukkondavargalukkaga mattum paavamannippu seiththaar. Idhu dhevan therindhukkondavargal mattum rakshikkappadugirargal enbadhai urudhi seyyum.

#### 4. Irresistible Grace (Thadukka Mudiyadha Kirubai)
- **Porul**: Dhevan thannudaiya kirubaiyai yaarukkaga koduththirukkiraaro, avargal adhai thadukka mudiyamaaga, adhai peruvargal. Dhevanudaiya kirubaiyai yaarum thadukka mudiyadhu.

#### 5. Perseverance of the Saints (Parisuththarudaiya Nilaiththiruththal)
- **Porul**: Dhevan therindhukkondavargal, avargaludaiya viswasaththil nilaiththiruppargal. Dhevan thannudaiya kirubaiyinaal avargalai kaapaththugiraar, avargal viswasaththil nilaiththiruppargal.

### Calvinism-in Mukkiya Karuthugalin Vilakkam

#### Total Depravity
- **Vilakkam**: Manithar piraviyaaga paavaththil irukkirargal. Manithar thangaludaiya siththaththinaal dhevanai thedi varavum, nalladhu seyyavum mudiyadhu. Dhevanudaiya kirubai illamal, manithar rakshikkappadum sadhiyillai.

#### Unconditional Election
- **Vilakkam**: Dhevan thannudaiya suththamaana siththaththinaal, sila manitharai therindhukkondirukkiraar. Idhu manitharudaiya seyalgalai paarththu illamal, dhevanudaiya kirubaiyinaal nadakkiradhu.

#### Limited Atonement
- **Vilakkam**: Yesu Kiristhu thannudaiya iraththaththinaal, dhevan therindhukkondavargalukkaga mattum paavamannippu seiththaar. Idhu dhevan therindhukkondavargal mattum rakshikkappadugirargal enbadhai urudhi seyyum.

#### Irresistible Grace
- **Vilakkam**: Dhevan thannudaiya kirubaiyai yaarukkaga koduththirukkiraaro, avargal adhai thadukka mudiyamaaga, adhai peruvargal. Dhevanudaiya kirubaiyai yaarum thadukka mudiyadhu.

#### Perseverance of the Saints
- **Vilakkam**: Dhevan therindhukkondavargal, avargaludaiya viswasaththil nilaiththiruppargal. Dhevan thannudaiya kirubaiyinaal avargalai kaapaththugiraar, avargal viswasaththil nilaiththiruppargal.

Calvinism enbathu, dhevanudaiya kirubai, siththam, viswasam, rakshippu enbadhai urudhi seyyum oru viswasam. Idhu ungalukku udhaviya irundha nambikkai! Vera edhaavadhu kelvi irundhaal sollunga.

how do whales sleep without drowning?

Whales have a unique way of sleeping that allows them to avoid drowning. Unlike humans, whales are conscious breathers, meaning they have to think about every breath they take. Here's how they manage to sleep without drowning:

1. **Unihemispheric Slow-Wave Sleep (USWS)**: Whales sleep by shutting down one hemisphere of their brain at a time. This allows them to maintain enough consciousness to come up for air and be aware of their surroundings, which is crucial for avoiding predators and navigating.

2. **Short Naps**: Whales take short naps rather than long periods of sleep. These naps can last from a few minutes to half an hour, during which they remain semi-conscious.

3. **Resting at the Surface**: Some species of whales rest at the surface of the water, a behavior known as "logging" because they resemble floating logs. This position makes it easier for them to breathe.

4. **Slow Swimming**: While sleeping, some whales continue to swim slowly, which helps them maintain a steady flow of water over their blowholes, making breathing easier.

These adaptations ensure that whales can get the rest they need without the risk of drowning.
how about fish?

Fish have different methods of resting and sleeping compared to mammals like whales. Here's how fish manage to rest without drowning:

1. **Reduced Activity and Metabolism**: Many fish enter a state of reduced activity and lower metabolism rather than a deep sleep. During this time, they remain alert to their surroundings but conserve energy.

2. **Resting on the Bottom**: Some fish rest on the bottom of their habitat, such as the ocean floor or the substrate in an aquarium. They may remain still or move very little, which helps them conserve energy.

3. **Hiding in Safe Spots**: Fish often find safe spots to rest, such as crevices, caves, or among plants. These spots provide protection from predators while they are less active.

4. **Buoyancy Control**: Fish have a swim bladder that helps them control their buoyancy. This allows them to remain at a certain depth without expending much energy, making it easier to rest.

5. **Unihemispheric Sleep**: Similar to whales, some fish can rest one hemisphere of their brain at a time, allowing them to stay partially alert and maintain basic functions like swimming and breathing.

6. **Gills for Breathing**: Fish continuously pass water over their gills to extract oxygen, even when they are resting. This means they don't need to come up for air like whales do.

These adaptations allow fish to rest and conserve energy while still being able to respond to threats and maintain essential functions.

5. **Group Safety**: Dolphins often sleep in groups, with some members staying more alert while others rest. This group behavior provides added protection from predators.

These adaptations ensure that dolphins can get the rest they need while still being able to breathe and stay safe in their aquatic environment.

how does eagles see from such distance?

Eagles have an extraordinary vision that allows them to see from great distances. Here are some key points about how they achieve this:

1. **Eye Structure**: Eagles have large eyes relative to their head size, which allows for a larger image to be projected onto the retina. This gives them a broader field of view and the ability to see more detail.

2. **Retina**: The retina of an eagle has a high density of photoreceptor cells, particularly cones, which are responsible for sharp, detailed vision and color detection. This high density allows eagles to detect even the smallest movements from far away.

3. **Fovea**: Eagles have two foveae (central focal points) in each eye, compared to humans who have only one. This allows them to focus on a wider range of distances simultaneously and track moving objects with greater precision.

4. **Magnification**: The lens and cornea of an eagle's eye work together to magnify images, making objects appear larger and closer than they actually are. This is similar to having built-in binoculars.

5. **UV Vision**: Eagles can see ultraviolet light, which helps them detect the urine trails of prey animals that are invisible to the human eye.

6. **Head Movement**: Eagles can rotate their heads about 270 degrees, which helps them scan their environment without moving their bodies, conserving energy while hunting.

These adaptations make eagles some of the most efficient predators in the avian world, capable of spotting prey from miles away.
how does combustion engine work?

A combustion engine works by burning fuel to create heat, which then produces mechanical energy. Here's a simplified breakdown of the process:

1. **Intake**: Air and fuel are drawn into the engine's cylinder.
2. **Compression**: The piston compresses the air-fuel mixture, making it more volatile.
3. **Power**: A spark plug ignites the compressed mixture, causing an explosion that pushes the piston down.
4. **Exhaust**: The piston moves back up, expelling the burnt gases through the exhaust valve.

This cycle repeats rapidly, generating the power needed to move a vehicle.

how do water flow?

Hey there! It looks like you're asking about how water flows. Water flow is influenced by gravity, pressure, and the physical properties of the water itself. Here are some key points:

1. **Gravity**: Water naturally flows from higher elevations to lower elevations due to gravity. This is why rivers flow downhill.

2. **Pressure**: Water moves from areas of high pressure to areas of low pressure. This principle is used in plumbing systems to direct water where it's needed.

3. **Surface Tension and Adhesion**: Water molecules stick to each other (cohesion) and to other surfaces (adhesion), which can affect how water flows over different materials.

4. **Channels and Pathways**: The shape and structure of the ground or any container can direct the flow of water. For example, rivers carve out channels that guide their flow.

how do stars form?

Stars form through a process called stellar formation, which happens over millions of years. Here's a simplified breakdown of how it works:

1. **Nebula**: It all starts in a nebula, which is a giant cloud of gas and dust in space. These clouds are mostly made up of hydrogen.

2. **Gravitational Collapse**: Over time, gravity causes the gas and dust in the nebula to clump together. As these clumps get bigger, their gravitational pull gets stronger, pulling in more material.

3. **Protostar Formation**: As the material clumps together, it forms a protostar. This is an early stage of a star's life. The protostar continues to gather material and its core temperature rises.

4. **Nuclear Fusion**: When the core temperature gets high enough (about 10 million degrees Celsius), nuclear fusion starts. This is when hydrogen atoms fuse together to form helium, releasing a huge amount of energy. This energy creates an outward pressure that balances the inward pull of gravity.

5. **Main Sequence Star**: Once nuclear fusion begins, the star enters the main sequence phase of its life. It will stay in this phase for most of its life, burning hydrogen into helium in its core.

6. **Stellar Evolution**: Eventually, the star will run out of hydrogen in its core. What happens next depends on the star's mass. Smaller stars become red giants and then white dwarfs, while larger stars can explode in supernovae and leave behind neutron stars or black holes.

Here's a simple diagram to illustrate the process:

Hello! Viviliam is a Tamil word for Bible. The Viviliam App is a comprehensive Bible application that enhances your Bible reading experience. It includes features such as:

- 5 Bible Versions: 3 Tamil Bibles (BSI, ERV, ETB) and 2 English Bibles (KJV, WEB)
- Audio Bibles for 2 Tamil Bibles and 2 English Bibles
- Advanced Search, Red Letter Verses, Bookmarks, Highlights, Notes
- Quizzes, Polls, Surveys, Contests
- Daily Song, Daily Proverbs, Daily Psalms
- WhatsApp Group, Clean Interface, Fully Customizable, Easy to Learn & Use, User Friendly

how to enter name during the game

To enter your name during the game in the Viviliam App, please follow these guidelines:

1. **Full Name**: Enter your full name.
2. **Initials**: Always place your initials after your name.
3. **No Punctuation**: Do not use full stops or commas in your name.
4. **All Caps**: Enter your name in all capital letters.

### Examples:
- JOHN WESLEY A
- DAVID LIVINGSTONE
- JENIFER JOHNSON
- NIRANJANA J
- JAMES K

### Additional Guidelines:
- **Do Not Abbreviate**: Avoid using short forms like Jo (John, Joel, Jothi), Sam (Samuel), Jeni (Jenifer), Jeba (Jebaraj, Jebakani).
- **No Titles**: Do not include titles like Mr, Mrs, Dr, Pr, Rev.
- **No Nicknames**: Avoid using nicknames or pet names (e.g., Ammu, Chellam, Kutti).
- **English Only**: Enter your name in English only. Do not use Tamil or other languages.

Failure to follow these rules may result in disqualification from receiving prizes, even if you secure a top position.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!

Here is the information about the contests and events in the Viviliam App:

### Event Schedule:
- **Crossword**: Mondays
- **Puzzle**: Wednesdays
- **Quiz**: Fridays

All events start at **9:30 PM** and end at **11:30 PM IST**.

### Event Types:
- **LIVE EVENT**: Held on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. These events are marked with a green circle in the Viviliam App.
- **REPEAT EVENT**: Held the day after a LIVE EVENT. You can participate in REPEAT EVENTS as many times as you want.

### Leaderboard Rules:
- **Weekly Leaderboard**: Includes all LIVE EVENTS held within a week. Published every Monday by 6 PM. Only participants of two or more events in a week will appear on the Weekly Leaderboard.
- **Instant Leaderboard**: Available only for REPEAT EVENTS. Shows the top 5 participants and may reset daily or at specific intervals.

### Prize Rules:
- Prizes are sent within a week from the announcement date.
- Contact Viviliam via WhatsApp within 2 days of the prize announcement to claim your prize.

- Do not use abbreviations, titles, or nicknames.

- **Audio Bibles**: 2 Tamil Bibles & 2 English Bibles
- **Compare Bibles**: Ellaa Bible versions-aiyum compare seyyalaam
- **Advanced Search**: Thedave easy-aaga irukkum
- **Red Letter Verses**: Jesus-oda vaarththaigal special-aaga highlight panniyirukkum
- **Bookmarks, Highlights, Notes**: Ungaluku pidicha verses-ai bookmark, highlight, note eduththukkalaam
- **Quizzes, Polls, Surveys, Contests**: Bible knowledge-ai improve seyyum activities
- **Daily Song, Daily Proverbs, Daily Psalms**: Dinamum oru paadal, proverbs, psalms
- **WhatsApp Group**: Viviliam WhatsApp group-il join pannalaam
- **Clean Interface, Fully Customizable, Easy to Learn & Use, User Friendly**: App romba user-friendly-aaga design panniyirukkanga

What is Viviliam?
What is Viviliam?

Viviliam is a Tamil word for Bible. The Viviliam App is a feature-rich application designed to enhance your Bible reading experience. It offers various features such as:

- 5 Bible Versions (3 Tamil Bibles: BSI, ERV, ETB and 2 English Bibles: KJV, WEB)
- Audio Bibles for 2 Tamil Bibles and 2 English Bibles
- Advanced Search
- Red Letter Verses
- Bookmarks, Highlights, and Notes
- Quizzes, Polls, Surveys, and Contests
- Daily Song, Daily Proverbs, and Daily Psalms
- Clean and fully customizable interface
- User-friendly and easy to learn and use

The app is free to download and use without ads and is available on the Play Store. The current version is 4.5.0, updated on August 21, 2024. The iOS version is planned for release in 2025.

Leaderboard
Leaderboard

Here's how the leaderboard works in the Viviliam App:

### Weekly Leaderboard
- **Includes**: All live events conducted within a week.
- **Update Time**: Every Monday by 6 PM.
- **Eligibility**: Only participants who have taken part in two or more events within the week will be featured.

### Instant Leaderboard
- **Applicable to**: Repeat events only.
- **Features**: Names of the top 5 participants.
- **Reset Frequency**: Daily or at specific intervals.

### Prize Rules
- **Name Registration**: Ensure your name is registered correctly as per the guidelines to be eligible for prizes.
- **Prize Dispatch**: Prizes will be sent within a week of the announcement.
- **Contact for Prize**: Reach out via WhatsApp within 2 days of the prize announcement to claim your prize. Delays may result in forfeiture.

How to install

Alternatively, you can use the direct link to the Viviliam App on the Play Store: [Viviliam App Play Store](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fredfrank.viviliam).
